title: Contributing
text: Create issue describing change. Work branch open pull request. Ensure R CMD check passes tests cover change.

title: Contributing
text: Please open issue include minimal reproducible example.

title: Data access and caching
text: Live downloads cached JSON user cache directory. can inspect cache location size:
code: vpdsus_cache_info() #> # A tibble: 1 × 3 #>   cache_dir                    n_files bytes #>   <chr>                          <int> <dbl> #> 1 /home/runner/.cache/R/vpdsus       0     0

title: Data access and caching
text: GHO API exposes indicator catalogue. Use gho_find_indicator() search code need, pass code get_coverage() get_cases(). vignette uses pinned fixture can run deterministically CI:
code: # Search the WHO GHO indicator metadata (offline fixture for this vignette) m <- gho_find_indicator("measles", top_n = 10, offline = TRUE) print(m) #> # A tibble: 6 × 2 #>   indicator_code indicator_name                                                  #>   <chr>          <chr>                                                           #> 1 MCV2           Measles-containing-vaccine second-dose (MCV2) immunization cov… #> 2 mslv           Measles immunization coverage among one-year-olds (%)           #> 3 vmsl           Measles immunization coverage among one-year-olds (%)           #> 4 WHS2_168       Distribution of causes of death among children aged <5 years (… #> 5 WHS3_62        Measles - number of reported cases                              #> 6 WHS8_110       Measles-containing-vaccine first-dose (MCV1) immunization cove…  # Two useful measles-related indicators in this list are: # - WHS8_110: MCV1 coverage # - WHS3_62: reported measles cases

title: Data access and caching
text: keep vignette deterministic, use pinned single-country fixtures : MCV1 coverage (USA, 2020) via indicator code WHS8_110 measles cases (USA, 2020) via indicator code WHS3_62 corresponding live calls : read pinned raw JSON standardise package output columns.
code: get_coverage("MCV1") get_cases("measles") # Coverage fixture p_cov <- system.file("extdata", "fixtures", "gho_WHS8_110_USA_2020.json", package = "vpdsus") txt_cov <- paste(readLines(p_cov, warn = FALSE, encoding = "UTF-8"), collapse = "\n") raw_cov <- jsonlite::fromJSON(txt_cov)$value cov <- tibble::as_tibble(raw_cov) |>   dplyr::transmute(     iso3 = toupper(trimws(as.character(.data$SpatialDim))),     year = as.integer(.data$TimeDim),     coverage = as.numeric(.data$Value) / 100   )  cov #> # A tibble: 1 × 3 #>   iso3   year coverage #>   <chr> <int>    <dbl> #> 1 USA    2020     0.91  # Cases fixture p_cases <- system.file("extdata", "fixtures", "gho_WHS3_62_USA_2020.json", package = "vpdsus") txt_cases <- paste(readLines(p_cases, warn = FALSE, encoding = "UTF-8"), collapse = "\n") raw_cases <- jsonlite::fromJSON(txt_cases)$value cases <- tibble::as_tibble(raw_cases) |>   dplyr::transmute(     iso3 = toupper(trimws(as.character(.data$SpatialDim))),     year = as.integer(.data$TimeDim),     cases = as.numeric(.data$Value)   )  cases #> # A tibble: 1 × 3 #>   iso3   year cases #>   <chr> <int> <dbl> #> 1 USA    2020  1275

title: Data access and caching
text: functions focus data retrieval standardisation. typical end--end analysis : builds modelling-ready panel (coverage + cases + demography), estimates susceptibility, produces -style risk ranking (optionally fits outbreak models). repository ships vpdsus_example_panel() workflow can demonstrated deterministically without live downloads:   See vignettes method choices modelling: Susceptibility estimates -style ranking plots Outbreak models
code: panel <- vpdsus_example_panel()  # 1) Susceptibility estimation (simple static method) sus <- estimate_susceptible_static(panel, coverage_col = "coverage", pop_col = "pop_0_4")  # 2) Risk ranking (summarise recent coverage and take susceptibility at a year) r <- risk_rank(panel, sus, window_years = 3, year_end = 2020)  # 3) Inspect / plot head(r) #> # A tibble: 3 × 9 #>   iso3  coverage_mean who_region country   susceptible_n susceptible_prop method #>   <chr>         <dbl> <chr>      <chr>             <dbl>            <dbl> <chr>  #> 1 NGA           0.557 AFR        Nigeria        15050000             0.43 static #> 2 PHL           0.73  WPR        Philippi…       3045000             0.29 static #> 3 AFG           0.67  EMR        Afghanis…       2145000             0.33 static #> # ℹ 2 more variables: risk_category <fct>, rank_global <int> plot_coverage_rank(r, top_n = 5) plot_susceptible_rank(r, top_n = 5)

title: Outbreak modelling
text: Columns mod: susceptible_prop: predictor (fraction susceptible) outcome: binary outbreak indicator year_next cases_per_100k available [make_outcome_outbreak()] original panel
code: library(vpdsus)  panel <- vpdsus_example_panel()  # Susceptibility method A (static): uses a population column and a coverage column suscept <- estimate_susceptible_static(panel, coverage_col = "coverage", pop_col = "pop_0_4")  # Create a modelling dataset with a 1-year lag between predictors and outcome. # outcome='outbreak_pc' uses a simple per-100k threshold defined in # make_outcome_outbreak(). mod <- make_modelling_panel(panel, suscept, outcome = "outbreak_pc", lag_years = 1) mod #> # A tibble: 6 × 10 #>   iso3   year year_next outcome susceptible_prop susceptible_n cases cases_next #>   <chr> <int>     <dbl>   <int>            <dbl>         <dbl> <int>      <int> #> 1 AFG    2018      2019       0             0.34       2142000  2400       3100 #> 2 AFG    2019      2020       1             0.32       2048000  3100       4200 #> 3 NGA    2018      2019       0             0.46      15180000  9800      12000 #> 4 NGA    2019      2020       0             0.44      14960000 12000       8800 #> 5 PHL    2018      2019       1             0.27       2781000 19000      28000 #> 6 PHL    2019      2020       0             0.25       2600000 28000       6000 #> # ℹ 2 more variables: pop_total <int>, who_region <chr>

title: Outbreak modelling
text: fit_outbreak_models() currently fits simple logistic regression: outcome ~ susceptible_prop + year + who_region
code: fit <- fit_outbreak_models(mod) fit$model #>  #> Call:  stats::glm(formula = outcome ~ susceptible_prop + year + who_region,  #>     family = stats::binomial(), data = data) #>  #> Coefficients: #>      (Intercept)  susceptible_prop              year     who_regionEMR   #>         4184.049          -102.979            -2.060             7.209   #>    who_regionWPR   #>               NA   #>  #> Degrees of Freedom: 5 Total (i.e. Null);  2 Residual #> Null Deviance:       7.638  #> Residual Deviance: 5.545     AIC: 13.55

title: Outbreak modelling
code: fit$coefficients #> # A tibble: 4 × 5 #>   term             estimate std_error statistic p_value #>   <chr>               <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>   <dbl> #> 1 (Intercept)       4184.    1626111.   0.00257   0.998 #> 2 susceptible_prop  -103.      40022.  -0.00257   0.998 #> 3 year                -2.06      800.  -0.00257   0.998 #> 4 who_regionEMR        7.21     2802.   0.00257   0.998

title: Outbreak modelling
text: evaluate_models() performs time split year (train earlier years, test later years) reports basic accuracy Brier score.
code: evaluate_models(mod) #> # A tibble: 1 × 5 #>   train_end n_train n_test accuracy brier #>       <dbl>   <int>  <int>    <dbl> <dbl> #> 1      2018       3      3    0.333 0.667

title: Authors and Citation
text: Oliver Watson. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Watson O (2026). vpdsus: Vaccine Preventable Disease Susceptibility Estimation Risk Scanning. R package version 0.0.1, https://ojwatson.github.io/vpdsus/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {vpdsus: Vaccine Preventable Disease Susceptibility Estimation and Risk Scanning},   author = {Oliver Watson},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.0.1},   url = {https://ojwatson.github.io/vpdsus/}, }

what: Vaccine Preventable Disease Susceptibility Estimation and Risk Scanning
title: Vaccine Preventable Disease Susceptibility Estimation and Risk Scanning
text: vpdsus R package : retrieve Global Health Observatory (GHO) immunisation coverage reported cases, combine demography, estimate vaccine-preventable disease (VPD) susceptibility via progressive methods (–D), produce -style risk ranking plots modelling-ready outputs.

title: Vaccine Preventable Disease Susceptibility Estimation and Risk Scanning
text: vpdsus helps : fetch GHO immunisation coverage reported cases time series, join demography country-year panel, estimate susceptibility using small set progressive methods, produce -style ranking plots modelling-ready outputs.

title: Vaccine Preventable Disease Susceptibility Estimation and Risk Scanning
text: Minimum verified defaults (intended work ---box via vpd_indicators()): Coverage (antigens): MCV1, MCV2 (measles-containing vaccine dose 1/2) Cases (diseases): measles antigens/diseases may work supplying explicit indicator_code. Notes: GHO indicator codes can discovered gho_find_indicator() overridden get_coverage(..., indicator_code=) / get_cases(..., indicator_code=). Defaults remain conservative: mapping verified, used implicitly.

title: Vaccine Preventable Disease Susceptibility Estimation and Risk Scanning
code: # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("OJWatson/vpdsus")

title: Vaccine Preventable Disease Susceptibility Estimation and Risk Scanning
text: optional features rely packages CRAN (e.g. mechanistic odin2 stack). required core workflow. want mechanistic functionality, install odin2 dust2 mrc-ide r-universe:
code: options(repos = c(   getOption("repos"),   "mrc-ide" = "https://mrc-ide.r-universe.dev" ))  install.packages(c("odin2", "dust2"))

title: Vaccine Preventable Disease Susceptibility Estimation and Risk Scanning
code: library(vpdsus)  panel <- vpdsus_example_panel()  sA <- estimate_susceptible_static(panel, coverage_col = "coverage", pop_col = "pop_0_4") rank <- risk_rank(panel = panel, suscept = sA)  plot_coverage_rank(rank) plot_susceptible_rank(rank)

title: Vaccine Preventable Disease Susceptibility Estimation and Risk Scanning
text: small targets pipeline scaffold lives analysis/targets/_targets.R runs shipped example data.
code: # install.packages("targets") setwd("analysis/targets")  targets::tar_make()  # Inspect outputs targets::tar_read(coverage_plot) targets::tar_read(susceptible_plot)

title: Vaccine Preventable Disease Susceptibility Estimation and Risk Scanning
text: Data access helpers cache-aware (local JSON caching GHO responses). Vignettes designed run quickly using shipped example datasets.

title: Vaccine Preventable Disease Susceptibility Estimation and Risk Scanning
text: get_demography() supports: source = "example" (default): uses shipped example data (external dependencies) source = "fixture_wpp": uses tiny shipped WPP-like fixture (deterministic; external dependencies) source = "wpp": uses wpp2024 installed (optional)

title: Vaccine Preventable Disease Susceptibility Estimation and Risk Scanning
text: package optional features use packages CRAN (currently including odin2, dust2, wpp2024). CI configured keep checks green without forcing installation Suggests (.e. _R_CHECK_FORCE_SUGGESTS_=false). Mechanistic functionality (odin2/dust2) additionally guarded behind VPDSUS_BUILD_ODIN2_VIGNETTE=1.

title: Vaccine Preventable Disease Susceptibility Estimation and Risk Scanning
text: MIT.

what: vpdsus — Milestones v2 (re-aligned to PDF spec + high documentation/reproducibility bar)
title: vpdsus — Milestones v2 (re-aligned to PDF spec + high documentation/reproducibility bar)
text: milestones derived PDF’s M0–M7, make definition--done explicit add stronger reproducibility/artefact requirement.

title: vpdsus — Milestones v2 (re-aligned to PDF spec + high documentation/reproducibility bar)
text: milestone “done” : - reproducible script/pipeline generate claimed artefacts, - outputs deterministic applicable (seeded), - caching/provenance explicit (URLs, query params, retrieval date, package version), - vignettes either runnable quickly fixtures, clearly marked “full run” opt-flags.

title: vpdsus — Milestones v2 (re-aligned to PDF spec + high documentation/reproducibility bar)
text: Deliverables: - spec_review_vs_pdf.md committed. - README tightened user-facing, explicit “Status vs milestones”. - Clarify disease/antigen scope list (minimum supported set) docs. DoD: - README internal dev chatter; points pkgdown + vignettes + analysis pipeline.

what: M1 — Data access (WHO coverage + cases) with verifiable mappings
title: vpdsus — Milestones v2 (re-aligned to PDF spec + high documentation/reproducibility bar)
text: Deliverables: - Verify document correct GHO indicator codes supported antigens/diseases. - Add small pinned fixture (cached JSON) least one indicator query tests. - Add tests : - URL construction correctness - ISO3 standardisation - caching key stability DoD: - Data access functions reproducible fixtures; live calls optional.

title: vpdsus — Milestones v2 (re-aligned to PDF spec + high documentation/reproducibility bar)
text: Deliverables: - Implement/verify UN WPP pathway (explicitly document chosen source), including births + age-structured population. - Panel builder produces canonical columns per PDF. DoD: - build_panel() (equivalent) can produce country-year panel pinned inputs.

title: vpdsus — Milestones v2 (re-aligned to PDF spec + high documentation/reproducibility bar)
text: Deliverables: - Methods –D reviewed PDF definitions; add missing pieces . - Add “golden” rank plot regression test using example data. - Provide vignette produces intended -style ranking outputs. DoD: - analysis/targets produces headline ranking figures deterministically.

title: vpdsus — Milestones v2 (re-aligned to PDF spec + high documentation/reproducibility bar)
text: Deliverables: - Multiple outcome definitions (abs vs per-capita vs exceedance), lag sensitivity. - Clear evaluation (time-split rolling) + baseline comparisons. - Output tables/figures suitable manuscript/presentation. DoD: - Pipeline step generates modelling results + diagnostics.

what: M5 — Mechanistic odin2 module (simulation success path)
title: vpdsus — Milestones v2 (re-aligned to PDF spec + high documentation/reproducibility bar)
text: Deliverables: - Mechanistic vignette : - compiles least one template - runs simulation - compares trajectories method D outputs - Still opt-CI (VPDSUS_BUILD_ODIN2_VIGNETTE=1). DoD: - enabled, vignette runs cleanly produces figures.

what: M6 — Optional inference hooks (rho/reporting fraction and/or MCMC)
title: vpdsus — Milestones v2 (re-aligned to PDF spec + high documentation/reproducibility bar)
text: Deliverables: - Choose implement one inference pathway PDF: - rho calibration / sensitivity (minimum), - optionally Bayesian/MCMC hook (dust2/odin2 compatible) - Add clear success criteria + minimal synthetic validation. DoD: - Documented inference API least one validated example.

title: vpdsus — Milestones v2 (re-aligned to PDF spec + high documentation/reproducibility bar)
text: Deliverables: - “Reproduce scratch” entrypoint: - either single targets plan Makefile wrapper - writes versioned artefacts analysis/outputs/ (similar) - Pkgdown site includes: - function reference - vignettes - reproducibility instructions DoD: - Fresh environment can reproduce main figures without manual steps (clearly documented credentialed data steps).

what: Calibrate rho for the case-balance susceptible recurrence — calibrate_rho_case_balance
title: Calibrate rho for the case-balance susceptible recurrence — calibrate_rho_case_balance
text: Calibrate reporting fraction rho susceptible balance recurrence used estimate_susceptible_case_balance() model matches target susceptible count chosen time.

title: Calibrate rho for the case-balance susceptible recurrence — calibrate_rho_case_balance
code: calibrate_rho_case_balance(   panel,   iso3,   years,   target_year,   target_susceptible_n,   births_col = "births",   coverage_col = "coverage",   cases_col = "cases",   s0 = NULL,   ve = 1,   rho_interval = c(1e-04, 1) )

title: Calibrate rho for the case-balance susceptible recurrence — calibrate_rho_case_balance
text: panel Panel data.frame/tibble containing least iso3/year/births, coverage, cases columns. iso3 ISO3 code filter panel. years Vector years (integers) use recurrence. Must covered panel iso3. target_year Year match target_susceptible_n. target_susceptible_n Target susceptible count target_year. births_col Births column. coverage_col Coverage column. cases_col Cases column. s0 Initial susceptible count first year; defaults births first year. ve Vaccine effectiveness multiplier applied coverage computing vaccinated births. rho_interval Search interval rho.

title: Calibrate rho for the case-balance susceptible recurrence — calibrate_rho_case_balance
text: scalar numeric rho.

title: Calibrate rho for the case-balance susceptible recurrence — calibrate_rho_case_balance
text: helper require {odin2}.

title: Calibrate rho for the case-balance susceptible recurrence — calibrate_rho_case_balance
code: panel <- data.frame(   iso3 = rep("AAA", 4),   year = 2000:2003,   births = 0,   coverage = 0,   cases = 10 )  # With s0=100, cases=10, rho=0.5 implies depletion per step = 10/0.5=20: # S: 100, 80, 60, 40 calibrate_rho_case_balance(   panel,   iso3 = "AAA",   years = 2000:2003,   target_year = 2003,   target_susceptible_n = 40,   s0 = 100,   rho_interval = c(0.1, 1) ) #> [1] 0.4999928

text: Convenience helper construct inputs= discrete-time susceptible balance odin2 model (model = "balance_discrete").

title: Build susceptible-balance inputs from a panel — odin2_balance_inputs_from_panel
code: odin2_balance_inputs_from_panel(   panel,   times,   iso3,   year_col = "year",   births_col = "births",   coverage_col = "coverage",   cases_col = "cases",   ve = 1 )

title: Build susceptible-balance inputs from a panel — odin2_balance_inputs_from_panel
text: panel Panel data.frame/tibble containing least iso3, year, births, coverage, cases columns (configurable via *_col). times Numeric/integer vector times (typically years) align . iso3 ISO3 code filter panel. year_col Year column. births_col Births column. coverage_col Coverage column interval [0, 1]; values outside clamped. (Coverage values bounded interval [0, 1].) cases_col Cases column. ve Vaccine effectiveness multiplier applied coverage computing vaccinated births (vaccinated = births * coverage * ve).

title: Build susceptible-balance inputs from a panel — odin2_balance_inputs_from_panel
text: Named list numeric vectors births, vaccinated, cases, length length(times).

title: Build susceptible-balance inputs from a panel — odin2_balance_inputs_from_panel
text: function require {odin2} {dust2}.

title: Build odin2 input vectors from a year-keyed tibble — odin2_inputs_from_tibble
text: data data frame/tibble containing time column (default year) one input columns (e.g. births, vaccinated, cases). times Numeric/integer vector times (typically years) align . cols Character vector input column names extract. time_col Name time column data. iso3 Optional ISO3 code filter data contains multiple countries. iso3_col Name ISO3 column data.

title: Build odin2 input vectors from a year-keyed tibble — odin2_inputs_from_tibble
text: Named list numeric vectors, length length(times).

what: vpdsus: VPD susceptibility estimation and risk scanning — vpdsus
title: vpdsus: VPD susceptibility estimation and risk scanning — vpdsus
text: Tools retrieve GHO immunisation coverage reported cases, join demography, estimate susceptibility via progressive methods (–E), produce -style risk ranking plots, link susceptibility outbreaks.

what: vpdsus — Spec Review vs PDF plan (VPD susceptibility package plan v0.1, 2026‑02‑07)
title: vpdsus — Spec Review vs PDF plan (VPD susceptibility package plan v0.1, 2026‑02‑07)
text: document gap analysis current OJWatson/vpdsus repository original PDF plan (“Blueprint R package estimate VPD susceptibility link outbreak risk”).

title: vpdsus — Spec Review vs PDF plan (VPD susceptibility package plan v0.1, 2026‑02‑07)
text: vpdsus substantially closer PDF spec motac : already coherent R package, cache-aware GHO access helpers, demography/panel scaffolding, susceptibility methods –D, basic outbreak-modelling helpers, opt-odin2 mechanistic pathway guarded CI. However, relative PDF’s stated primary deliverable (“end--end analysis pipeline reproduces main figures scratch”) high-quality engineering goals, still notable gaps: End--end reproducibility currently relies example data minimal targets pipeline; yet demonstrate full--scratch reproduction real /UN inputs versioned artefacts. Data sources implemented via GHO OData endpoints, PDF emphasises “authoritative public sources primarily UN” careful harmonisation—exists (ISO3 harmonisation, caching), full provenance/artefact strategy needs strengthening. Modelling module exists still lightweight vs spec’s goal (multiple outcome definitions, model evaluation, clear modelling datasets, richer diagnostics). Mechanistic module exists correctly guarded, spec expects clearer “success criteria” path (optionally) inference hooks; yet “paper-quality” bar. Documentation/site exists (pkgdown + vignettes), “public-ready release” milestone implies comprehensive reproducibility story clearer guidance new user.

title: vpdsus — Spec Review vs PDF plan (VPD susceptibility package plan v0.1, 2026‑02‑07)
text: PDF’s primary deliverable : - installable R package + vignettes, - end--end analysis workflow reproduces “main figures” scratch. Milestones PDF M0–M7: - M0 scaffolding - M1 data access (coverage + cases) - M2 demography + panel building - M3 susceptibility v1 + -style plots - M4 statistical models linking susceptibility outbreaks - M5 mechanistic scaffolding (odin2 simulation) - M6 optional inference hooks - M7 public-ready release (pkgdown + full reproducibility)

what: M0 — Repository skeleton and professional scaffolding
title: vpdsus — Spec Review vs PDF plan (VPD susceptibility package plan v0.1, 2026‑02‑07)
text: Implemented: mostly. Concrete gaps/corrections vs spec1.pdf: Scope needs explicit. PDF expects minimum supported set antigens/diseases clear defaults. repo currently includes multiple placeholders/partially-verified indicator codes; tightened new users don’t accidentally rely unverified defaults. Reproducibility story needs clearer “happy path”. PDF emphasises end--end reproduction; repo vignettes + analysis/targets/, README yet clearly explain reproducibility workflow (downloaded live vs cached/fixture, re-run). Definition Done (DoD) M0 wasn’t explicitly stated. Add checklist must satisfied advancing M1. M0 Definition Done (DoD): CI (R-CMD-check + lint + pkgdown) green main. .Rbuildignore / .gitignore exclude local tooling artefacts hidden dirs (accidental notes). README : package purpose, minimum supported scope (antigens/diseases), installation, quick-start, reproducibility section. README explicitly documents optional/non-CRAN Suggests mechanistic gate (VPDSUS_BUILD_ODIN2_VIGNETTE=1). vpd_indicators() defaults either () verified, (b) clearly flagged unverified used implicitly. “discovery” helpers (e.g., gho_find_indicator()) documented way find indicator codes. spec_review_vs_pdf.md includes concrete corrections/gaps points next milestone (M1) acceptance criteria.

what: M1 — Data access: WHO coverage and cases
title: vpdsus — Spec Review vs PDF plan (VPD susceptibility package plan v0.1, 2026‑02‑07)
text: Implemented: mostly. - gho_get(), gho_find_indicator(), get_coverage(), get_cases() exist. Gaps / risks: - Indicator mapping defaults (vpd_indicators()) look partly placeholder-ish (e.g. MEASLESCASES); needs verification actual GHO codes /explicit docs discover right codes. - Need explicit acceptance tests hit live API (possibly non-CRAN CI job) pinned cached fixtures recorded request URLs.

what: M2 — Demography retrieval and panel building
title: vpdsus — Spec Review vs PDF plan (VPD susceptibility package plan v0.1, 2026‑02‑07)
text: Implemented: partial. - Demography module exists (R/data-demography.R, R/panel-build.R), detailed check PDF’s preferred sources (UN WPP) fallback strategy needed. Gap: end--end build real country-year-age panel raw sources yet demonstrated reproducible artefact.

what: M3 — Susceptibility estimates v1 + WHO-style plots
title: vpdsus — Spec Review vs PDF plan (VPD susceptibility package plan v0.1, 2026‑02‑07)
text: Implemented: partial--good. - Susceptibility methods exist: - : estimate_susceptible_static() - B: estimate_susceptible_cohort() - C: estimate_susceptible_cohort_ve() - D: estimate_susceptible_case_balance() (incl. rho sensitivity) - Plotting/risk ranking exists (risk_rank(), plotting functions, theme). Gap: PDF emphasises minimum supported set diseases/antigens “-style risk ranking figures”; verify current plots match intended outputs add “golden figure” regression test using pinned example data.

what: M4 — Statistical modelling linking susceptibility to outbreaks
title: vpdsus — Spec Review vs PDF plan (VPD susceptibility package plan v0.1, 2026‑02‑07)
text: Implemented: partial. - make_modelling_panel(), fit_outbreak_models(), evaluate_models() exist. Gaps: - Broader outcome definitions, model comparisons, diagnostics (e.g. ROC/AUC, calibration curves, sensitivity lag choice) yet present. - PDF implies clean modelling datasets evaluation; current helpers start yet research-grade.

title: vpdsus — Spec Review vs PDF plan (VPD susceptibility package plan v0.1, 2026‑02‑07)
text: Implemented: partial. - odin2 template compilation + dust2 simulation exists templates shipped. - Correctly guarded (Suggests + env var). Gaps: - Need clear “mechanistic success” vignette runs end--end enabled, produces small set sanity-check figures.

title: vpdsus — Spec Review vs PDF plan (VPD susceptibility package plan v0.1, 2026‑02‑07)
text: Implemented: minimal. - Rho calibration work exists (files suggest direction), needs review PDF’s requested pathways (reporting fraction, MCMC hooks) crisp DoD.

title: vpdsus — Spec Review vs PDF plan (VPD susceptibility package plan v0.1, 2026‑02‑07)
text: Implemented: partial. - Pkgdown site exists. - Vignettes exist. Gaps: - “Full reproducibility scratch” yet met: need single command pipeline pulls raw sources (clearly documented cached inputs), writes versioned artefacts, regenerates headline figures.

title: vpdsus — Spec Review vs PDF plan (VPD susceptibility package plan v0.1, 2026‑02‑07)
text: Authoritative, reproducible data artefacts: decide downloaded live vs shipped pinned fixtures; write provenance metadata. End--end pipeline: strengthen analysis/targets/ real reproduction pipeline can (optionally) run scratch produce figures/tables. Modelling evaluation: expand modelling include small set robust checks consistent PDF.

title: vpdsus 0.0.1
text: Initial package scaffolding. Data access helpers (GHO OData) caching. Panel building, susceptibility estimation methods –D, plotting. Modelling helpers odin2 scaffolding (optional).
